Dialogue.NPCText:
A poised woman in a crimson kimono fans herself on the porch, gaze sharp as a blade.

“You stand before Matsuo Gozen, once shield of the Shogun, now guardian of Hinokami’s grace.
State your purpose. Are you here for instruction, for gossip, or to test the edge of tradition?”

Option.text: I wish to learn the art of the onna-bugeisha.
I come seeking wisdom and etiquette.
What is your story, Gozen?
Tell me of your life before Hinokami.
Just looking around.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Matsuo flicks her fan open with a *snap*, eyes narrowing.

“Martial grace is not won by blood alone, but by discipline and honor.
Are you prepared to be judged as both a warrior and a guest of Hinokami?”

Option.text: Judge me by my skill and spirit.
I have faced battle, but seek true discipline.
Perhaps I should return later.

Dialogue.NPCText: Matsuo regards you closely, her fan pausing.

Her sternness softens ever so slightly.
“Few seek the path of the onna-bugeisha these days. If you would train under me, you must balance poise with ferocity. Shall we begin?”
She flips her fan, revealing the steel edge.
“Show me you can strike—yet know when to sheath the blade.”

Option.text: I am ready. Teach me your riposte.
I seek training in etiquette and the sword.
Another time, perhaps.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Matsuo’s gaze lingers, skeptical.
“Tradition guards these teachings. Outsiders must prove their honor—talk is cheap, but action weighs heavy in Hinokami.
Bring me proof of a worthy deed—help a villager, defend the shrine, or win respect in the arena. Then, perhaps, I will consider your request.”

Option.text: What deed would prove my worth?
Understood. I will return when I have proved myself.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Aid Lady Aiko with the cherry blossom festival, or rescue a merchant from the Verdant border. Return with a Petal of Honor—a token you will earn from those you aid. Only then shall the dojo’s doors open to you.”

Option.text: I accept this challenge.
Option.action: SendMessage:Seek those in need throughout Hinokami. Return with the Petal of Honor.

Option.text: I will prove myself before returning.
I already have the Petal of Honor.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Matsuo’s eyes widen, then nods approvingly.
“You have earned this. I will instruct you—but remember, honor is a path, not a destination.”

Option.text: Thank you, sensei.
I am not yet ready.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She walks you through the dance of the fan—slashing, deflecting, striking.
“The fan is not merely for grace, but for cunning. Let every motion be both invitation and threat.”
You feel your swordplay quicken, with a subtle edge of elegance.

Option.text: Bow in gratitude.
Option.action: SendMessage:You feel more graceful in combat. (+3 Swords for 10m)

Option.text: Ask about etiquette training.
End training.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Strength is wasted without respect. In Hinokami, every bow, every word, is a blade or a shield.”
Matsuo teaches you the nuances of posture, speech, and composure.
You sense that even in conversation, you are now harder to provoke.

Option.text: Thank you, sensei.
Option.action: AddSkill:Etiquette,2,600;SendMessage:You have gained etiquette training (+2 Etiquette for 10m).

Option.text: Return to sword training.
End training.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Both sword and word—learn them together, and you shall walk the path of the onna-bugeisha in full.”
Matsuo guides you through a ritual blending blade forms with graceful bows and subtle social moves.
“Let the world see your strength, but only as much as you wish.”

Option.text: Bow and thank Matsuo Gozen.
Option.action: SendMessage:You feel both deadlier and more poised. (+2 Swords, +2 Etiquette for 10m)

Option.text: Ask for more advanced lessons.
End training.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Matsuo’s eyes flash with pride.
“You have learned well, but beware: in times of chaos, even the sharpest blade may falter if the spirit breaks. Seek wisdom in adversity, and return to me when you are ready for the Hidden Form.”

Option.text: What is the Hidden Form?
I will return when I am worthy.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The Hidden Form is taught only to those who have aided Hinokami in our darkest hour. Should Minax’s assassins threaten our shrine, stand with us and your name will be inscribed among the defenders.”
(This quest will become available in future updates.)

Option.text: I understand. I await the call.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Wisdom is the mother of all arts. You wish etiquette? Learn first that in every gesture, intent hides. A fan may conceal a dagger, but it also shields a heart.”
Matsuo demonstrates a courtly bow, then a subtle feint.
“Shall I instruct you in these ways?”

Option.text: Please teach me.
Perhaps I should learn swordplay instead.
Another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Matsuo Gozen closes her fan, eyes distant.
“I crossed the seas from Tokuno with Shogun Takamura’s retinue, when Minax’s shadow first fell. I held the line at the Blossom Gate, and I have seen the best— and worst—of both worlds. Now, I instruct those who would keep our flame alive, in sword and in soul.”
She fixes you with a fierce smile.
“Every exile shapes her own legend. What legend will you write?”

Option.text: Perhaps you will teach me to shape my own.
Thank you for sharing your story.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Then observe. The ways of Hinokami are open to any who show respect—and sharp eyes.”

Option.text: I will watch and learn.
On second thought, may I train with you?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Matsuo folds her fan slowly, her tone lower and more personal.

“Before Hinokami… there was fire. Blood on rice fields, cherry blossoms falling on scorched armor. I was the edge of a fallen empire’s last breath. We fought to hold Tokuno against the storm Minax sent… and failed.”

She turns, letting the silence hang.
“But a warrior endures. Even exile can be a rebirth.”

Option.text: You survived a war against Minax?
What brought you to this land?
Do you ever miss Tokuno?
Do you still follow the warrior path?
Thank you for sharing.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I was one of the Hibashira—the Fire Pillars. Our order was elite, trained to end battles with a single stroke.”
She lifts her sleeve, revealing a faint scar like lightning.
“Minax twisted Tokuno’s warlords with her promises. Some we slew. Others… we could not.”

“But her greatest weapon was despair. It broke more blades than any army.”

Option.text: And yet you did not break.
Were others of the Hibashira lost?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Matsuo closes her eyes.
“We were seven. Only I remain.”

She retrieves a worn prayer strip tucked in her obi, its ink faded.
“Every moon, I light lanterns for them. In Hinokami, I rebuilt what I could—discipline, honor, memory. But there are nights I wake with sword in hand… alone.”

Option.text: I will honor their memory too.
Option.action: Karma:+100;SendMessage:You feel a quiet respect settle over you.

Option.text: They live on through your teachings.
Option.action: Fame:+100;SendMessage:Your words seem to strengthen her resolve.

Option.text: That is a burden few could bear.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“We crossed the Sea of Tears in silence. No homeland. No banner. Just a ship full of survivors and a Shogun with nothing left to rule.”

“Hinokami rose from hardship. But we brought more than weapons—we brought art, tradition, and the belief that grace could bloom even in foreign soil.”

Option.text: What art do you cherish most?
You built a legacy from ashes.
Let us speak of something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A rare smile tugs at her lips.
“Ikebana. The placing of flowers with intent. Even in war, I would gather blossoms. Balance requires contrast. Beauty softens wrath. Without grace, a warrior becomes a beast.”

“Would you… like to learn?”

Option.text: Yes, I would.
I don’t think I have the patience for that.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She gently places a single blossom in a ceramic dish and gestures for you to do the same.

“Feel the shape of it. The flow. The tension between life and stillness.”

You feel something stir—discipline, serenity, perhaps something more.

Option.text: I feel... focused.
Option.action: AddStat:Int,5,600;SendMessage:You feel more centered. (+5 Int for 10m)

Option.text: Strange how flowers can teach the soul.
Option.action: AddSkill:Etiquette,2,600;SendMessage:You gain insight in decorum and poise.

Option.text: Thank you for this lesson.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Matsuo fans herself slowly.

“Every time I smell cherry blossoms, I remember the courtyard at dawn. I remember the shamisen before a duel, the laughter before war.”

“But Hinokami is not lesser—it is the second act. The soul’s story does not end with exile.”

Option.text: You speak like a poet.
Option.action: Fame:+50;SendMessage:Matsuo nods, perhaps a little flattered.

Option.text: Have you written these memories down?
Thank you for sharing.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She hesitates, then retrieves a small lacquered scroll from her sleeve.

“One verse, for the wind to carry:

Steel meets silk in dusk—
Even in foreign gardens,
The blade remembers.


“You may carry it. Let its words temper you.”

Option.text: Accept the poem scroll.
Option.action: GiveItem:HinokamiPoemScroll;Karma:+50;SendMessage:You receive a scroll of memory and grace.

Option.text: Thank you, Gozen.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The warrior’s path never ends. It narrows. It turns. But it remains.”

“I teach not to win battles—but to preserve the thread that binds us. Bushido is not a sword art. It is a way to live.”
She rises, gazing toward the training ring.
“If you are still curious… the dojo welcomes those who bow in respect.”

Option.text: I would train with you now.
I needed to hear this. Thank you.
Option.action: Karma:+75;SendMessage:You feel the clarity of her path settle into your bones.

Option.text: Farewell, Gozen.
